alert.note: Alert for Durham; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 8:13PM EST until December 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Durham and Wake. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 807 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Zebulon, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, William B Umstead State Park and Research Triangle. - In addition to usual flood prone locations, based on gauge reports flooding is likely also occurring at the following locations: The lower parking lot in the Crabtree Valley Mall parking garage. Secondary roads near Atlantic Avenue in Raleigh. Parking lot areas upstream of Stony Brook Drive. Roads and other locations along Crabtree Creek and Walnut Creek, especially Rose Lane and the Greenways. Areas along Third Fork Creek in Durham, including the adjacent Trail, where the creek is likely coming out of its banks. Water may be approaching the Durham Department of Public Works parking lot.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Slow down and use caution while driving to avoid hydroplaning. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
